clinical_study.official_title: Psychosocial Factors and Adherence to Treatment in Patients With Hemophilia. A Multicenter Study

brief_summary.textblock: Psychosocial factors and adherence to treatment in patients with hemophilia. A multicenter study. Multicenter cross sectional study of patients with hemophilia and their families

detailed_description.textblock:
Research project whose main objective is to assess adherence and major psychosocial issues affecting patients with hemophilia and their families treated at the Hematology and hemotherapy Services Clinical Hospital Universitario Virgen de la Arrixaca of Murcia and the University Hospital Carlos Haya, Malaga.
The data obtained in this project will identify those psychosocial aspects affecting patients and their families about the disease, its evolution and treatment of it. They will use different psychosocial questionnaires based on scientific evidence and the reliability of these, as well as its specific design for hemophilia patients. The main characteristics of the study are:
- Descriptive study of adherence to treatment of pediatric patients, adolescents and adults with hemophilia.
- Descriptive study of family functioning, perceived stress, anxiety and quality of life in parents of children with hemophilia under 14 years and adolescents with hemophilia, depending on the administered medical treatment, clinical and musculoskeletal patient situation.
- Descriptive study of illness behavior or perception of illness, perceived stress, anxiety, quality of life and coping strategies of young adults with hemophilia, depending on the medical treatment administered, and skeletal muscle clinical situation of the patient.
- Validation of psychosocial assessment tools in patients with hemophilia and their families.

primary_outcome.measure: Assess the perception of quality of life
primary_outcome.description: The quality of life assessed with the questionnaires: Short Form-36 Health Survey (SF-36) and A36 Hemofilia-QoL for adults; and Child Report Form (CHIP-CE) and Haemo-QoL, for children.

primary_outcome.measure: Assess the perception of illness of the patients
primary_outcome.description: To measure this variable we use the Illness Perception Questionnaire Revised (IPQ-R).

primary_outcome.measure: Assess anxiety of patients and parents of children with hemophilia.
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate this variable we use the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI)

primary_outcome.measure: To assess illness behavior of patients.
primary_outcome.description: To assess this variable we use the illness behaviour questionnaire (IBQ).
To assess this variable we use the Coping Scale questionnaire.

primary_outcome.measure: Assess the perception of family functioning of parents of children with hemophilia
primary_outcome.description: To assess this variable we use the Family Functioning Evaluation Scale (FACES III).

primary_outcome.measure: Assess the perceived stress of parents of children with hemophilia.
primary_outcome.description: To assess this variable we use the Pediatric Inventory for Parents (PIP).

primary_outcome.measure: Assessing the personality traits of children with hemophilia.
primary_outcome.description: To assess this variable we use the Eysenck Personality Questionnaire Junior (EPQ-J)

primary_outcome.measure: Assess adherence to treatment of patients with hemophilia.
primary_outcome.description: To assess this variable we use the Beliefs About Medication Questionnaire (BMQ).

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the clinical data of the patient
secondary_outcome.description: Type of hemophilia (A or B), severity of hemophilia (severe, moderate or mild), treatment type (a demand or prophylaxis), presence of ingibidores, history of hemarthrosis, dosage factor VIII / IX

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the demographic data of the patient
secondary_outcome.description: Age, history of hemophilia in the family, marital status (single, married, divorced), education (university, basic), employment status (unemployed, self-employed, employed by others), distance to hospital

arm_group.description: Hemophilia patients (children, youth and adults) and parents of children with hemophilia under 18

study_pop.textblock: Patients with haemophilia treated at the Hospital Clínico Universitario Virgen de la Arrixaca de Murcia, and the Hospital Clínico Universitario Carlos Haya (Málaga)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with hemophilia A or B
- Patients followed at the Hematology Department of the hospitals included in the study
- Patients without cognitive disorders
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with other congenital coaguopatías
- Patients with more than 2 years without going to review your hospital
- Patients from other provinces of Spain
